page.title: 04FARMING IN HARDWICK
page.content: Farming is obviously a dominant feature of this area, as indicated by the vast amount of{grassland}and {crops.}Many of the farms are{family {concerns}but are now{larger}in size than in the past, as dictated by the need to be efficient. The increase in the amount of land per farm obviously means that some farmhouses are made "redundant". In the village of {Hardstoft}part of one such house had been converted into a{lighting {equipment firm. The techniques used are obviously modern and it was interesting to note that several families, although from farming stock, had chosen to spend time training at{agricultural college. The main produce was{cereal crops}and many farms had{cattle}for{dairy produce and{beef. Sheep}were also a common asset.
